rev.comment: /* Numerals */ Hopefully this would help avoid confusion with the listed Eastern Arabic numerals
del. "living" - implies that some extinct Sem. lang. had more speakers: surely not.

/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */ Pre-Islam Berber & Egyptian influence hardly seems possible since Egyptian was nearly extinct and not in contact with Berber at that time
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */
"Libro" is "book" only in Spanish, not in Portuguese; it's "livro" in Portuguese
clean up, typos fixed: muslim → Muslim, arabic → Arabic using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */ cl
Rv. While these words are of Arabic origin and are found in Portuguese, they did not enter English through Portuguese, and that's the topic of the sentence
Rv incorrect claim. There are many Portuguese nouns beginning with al- that don't have an Arabic origin
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 261424647 by [[Special:Contributions/Kwamikagami|Kwamikagami]] ([[User talk:Kwamikagami|talk]]) Not consistent with other articles
1)Edit war was over which countries to include in country listing, not to do away with country listing entirely. 2)You've removed a reliable source for the second time.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 261420554 by [[Special:Contributions/Middayexpress|Middayexpress]] ([[User talk:Middayexpress|talk]]) Removal is justified to end edit war over Malta. See Talk
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 261419409 by [[Special:Contributions/Taivo|Taivo]] ([[User talk:Taivo|talk]])restored source from editor's POV, unjustified removal
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 261418965 by [[Special:Contributions/Middayexpress|Middayexpress]] ([[User talk:Middayexpress|talk]]) See talk page and discuss there. You have not made a single argument
Please don't restore old revisions; that revision was as of September 23 and it removes all changes made in the past three months
Restored list of countries where Arabic is spoken from one editor's attempt to reduce them to just two regions. Edit war was not over regions vs. countries but which countries ought to be included.
Restored region list rather than specific country list which was subject to edit warring
Added flags for the Arabic-speaking states just like on the [[Swahili language|Swahili]] page.
Restored nations where Arabic is spoken from uniformative and incomplete 'region' change.
/* Literary and Modern Standard Arabic */ again, what is a 'mere' dialect?
"Region" is for languages like this where a laundry list of countries is meaningless and, in some cases, misleading
RV edit warring POV, note Peitru this is your 3rd rv, you are edit warring
Arabic isn't spoken in Malta either. The Maltese Language is.
Arabic is not spoken in either Kenya or Uganda by the country's native inhabitants, and is not an official language in either country
/* Literary and Modern Standard Arabic */ what's a 'mere' dialect? It's rubbish like this that makes these articles so tiresome.
as per Kinubi. I'll add others later.
RV removal of Malta (2nd time, warning 3revs is edit warring). If the editor wishes to make a case against the linguistic classification of Maltese as an Arabic variety, do so in Talk first.
Arabic is not spoken in Malta in any great number.. source this false claim if it is to remain!
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */ too bad the anon ips don't know how to format :p
/* Influence of Arabic on other languages */
proximity to north african coast makes this nonsense
Arabic is not spoken in Malta in any great number
Removed "Palestine" in list of places spoken. "Palestinian territories" is already listed.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 260641352 by [[Special:Contributions/Causteau|Causteau]] ([[User talk:Causteau|talk]]) See Talk page
/* Dialects and descendants */ explaining why Maghrebi Arabic can be difficult for speakers of Near Eastern Arabic varieties to understand per the Kaplan source
/* Dialects and descendants */ Clarified Berber relationship. McCarus is just a brief synopsis, not a detailed survey as Bateson is. But "substrates" exist for all the Arabic varieties, not just Mag.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 260636090 by [[Special:Contributions/Causteau|Causteau]] ([[User talk:Causteau|talk]]) There is "some" Berber influence, not "massive" Berber influence
Bateson says that Arabic dialects in N.A. show varying degrees of Berber influence, not no Berber influence; ref I've cited cites many other sources which point to phonological & vocab. influences
/* Dialects and descendants */ Bateson systematically lists differences, but they are not linked to Berber. Berber only affects rural varieties of Maghrebi in vocabulary, not grammar
/* Dialects and descendants */ It is not just Berber influence, but natural linguistic changes independent of Berber
fixed .png-->.svg and changed caption to include legend
Correction to listed lanuages that borrow arabic word for 'book'. No similar word exists in Tagalog

/* Literary and Modern Standard Arabic */ new para
/* Literary and Modern Standard Arabic */ reword,, split sentence, rm unsourced, moved para to first, split first into 2 paras, add cn
/* Literary and Modern Standard Arabic */ new para, remove definition of media altogether
/* Literary and Modern Standard Arabic */ fix translation, cut down on definition of printed matter
/* Studying Arabic */ revise, cut down run-on, change vague wording
/* See also */ Addition of one of the most useful free websites for learning Arabic - non commercial and open source project to teach Arabic.
